content.text: ElizaOS is undergoing a plugin registry migration. Developers can now submit their plugins via a pull request to an index.json file, which can be hosted on their GitHub. New documentation is also in progress.

ElizaOS is likely to release a v1.5 update to bridge the gap between v1 and v2. The current v1 has all plugins in a single repository, making installation time-consuming. v2 aims to improve this by restructuring plugin management.

The ElizaOS launchpad is 95% complete, pending partner confirmations. Tokenomics are also nearly finalized, with liquidity pools pairing all current and future tributes to the ai16z token. A new business development team has been established.
Major breaking changes in ElizaOS are almost complete, with the team working towards finalizing updates.
A new pull request has been submitted to add character methods to ElizaOS. However, it increases adapter size and is not fully tested yet.
A fix has been introduced requiring the core to be built first, with a new `build:core` command added.
A new feature called 'VangAI' has been proposed, described as a Crypto Oracle. The pull request includes risk assessments and testing details.
A pull request has been submitted to integrate the Nillion frontend into ElizaOS.
The open-source AI community is giving off nostalgic vibes, particularly with the rise of exo clusters.

A user shares their experience with @fere_ai, an AI tool they have been using daily for a month. They have configured it to provide a list of trending AI tokens on Solana every 12 hours and summarize sentiment on AI tokens.
A list of AI resources is shared, including an AI search engine that competes with Google and has replaced it for the user. Other tools like cursor/aider are also mentioned.
Users are encouraged to join the ai16z partners chat to ask questions, as the team is responsive.

If you have a real Discord chat transcript with meaningful discussions, please provide it, and I will be happy to analyze it according to your requested format.

Recent development efforts focused on package improvements, new features, and bug fixes. A total of 32 contributors merged 15 pull requests, addressing issues such as plugin-solana-v2 package.json fixes and setting package publish access to public. Major work included merging pull requests related to model configurations, unit tests, endpoint updates, and various code changes.
Additionally, 13 contributors merged 2 pull requests, contributing to various improvements.
A fix was implemented to resolve build issues when running `bun run build` in the root directory.
A minor syntax correction was made by deleting an unnecessary `}` in `alexa-client.ts`.
The Twitter client system message has been edited, along with modifications to the character file. Additionally, the Shopify parsing logic has been adjusted to correctly parse Twitter data.

A pull request related to Twitter includes a structured template for documenting changes, risks, and testing procedures. The update may involve bug fixes, improvements, or new features, though specific details are not provided.

categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Plugin Registry Migration

content.text: ElizaOS is undergoing a plugin registry migration. Developers can now submit their plugins via pull requests to an index.json file, which can be hosted on their GitHub repositories. New documentation is also in progress and will be shared once ready.
A large number of plugin submissions have been received, and an assistant is being trained to help follow up with contributors.

ElizaOS is planning a v1.5 release to bridge the gap between v1 and v2. The current v1 has all plugins in a single repository, making installation complex, while v2 aims to modularize plugins for better management.
Development efforts are focused on package improvements, new features, and bug fixes. Recent work includes merging pull requests related to model configurations, unit tests, and endpoint updates.
Several pull requests have been merged into the ElizaOS repository, including improvements to character methods, build fixes, Twitter client system message updates, and Shopify integration.
A new database adapter using Drizzle ORM has been implemented, introducing structured schema management, vector operations, and improved error handling.
A major update externalized vendor code from the core, allowing third-party plugins to handle various functionalities. This change aims to improve scalability and user reach.

An issue was identified where the Eliza bot generates multiple replies due to the `DEFAULT_MAX_TWEET_LENGTH` setting. This leads to excessive API calls and increased token usage. A temporary fix involves increasing the character limit.
